parts: Make a table detailing operations on javascript arrays, specifying whether it modifies or does not modify the original array

Here is a table detailing various operations on JavaScript arrays, specifying whether they modify the original array or not:

| **Operation**            | **Description**                                          | **Modifies Original Array?** |
|--------------------------|------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------|
| `push(element)`          | Adds an element to the end of the array            | ✅ Yes |
| `pop()`                  | Removes the last element of the array              | ✅ Yes |
| `shift()`                | Removes the first element of the array             | ✅ Yes |
| `unshift(element)`       | Adds an element to the beginning of the array      | ✅ Yes |
| `splice(start, deleteCount, ...items)` | Adds/removes elements at a specific index | ✅ Yes |
| `sort(compareFunction)`  | Sorts the array in place                           | ✅ Yes |
| `reverse()`              | Reverses the order of elements in place           | ✅ Yes |
| `fill(value, start, end)`| Fills elements with a static value                | ✅ Yes |
| `copyWithin(target, start, end)` | Copies elements within the array             | ✅ Yes |
| `map(callback)`          | Creates a new array by applying a function        | ❌ No |
| `filter(callback)`       | Creates a new array with elements that pass the test | ❌ No |
| `slice(start, end)`      | Returns a portion of the array as a new array      | ❌ No |
| `concat(array2, ...)`    | Merges arrays into a new array                     | ❌ No |
| `reduce(callback, initialValue)` | Reduces the array to a single value      | ❌ No |
| `reduceRight(callback, initialValue)` | Reduces the array from right to left | ❌ No |
| `every(callback)`        | Checks if all elements pass a test (returns boolean) | ❌ No |
| `some(callback)`         | Checks if at least one element passes a test (returns boolean) | ❌ No |
| `find(callback)`         | Returns the first element that matches the condition | ❌ No |
| `findIndex(callback)`    | Returns the index of the first element that matches the condition | ❌ No |
| `includes(value)`        | Checks if the array contains a certain value (returns boolean) | ❌ No |
| `indexOf(value)`        | Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value | ❌ No |
| `lastIndexOf(value)`    | Returns the index of the last occurrence of a value | ❌ No |
| `join(separator)`       | Joins elements into a string                       | ❌ No |
| `toString()`            | Converts the array into a string                   | ❌ No |
| `flat(depth)`           | Flattens a nested array into a single-level array  | ❌ No |
| `flatMap(callback)`     | Maps and flattens in one step                      | ❌ No |

Would you like additional details or examples for any of these?
